commands.name: az sql db replica create
commands.summary: Create a database as a readable secondary replica of an existing database.
commands.syntax:
az sql db replica create --name
                         --partner-server
                         --resource-group
                         --server
                         [--assign-identity {false, true}]
                         [--auto-pause-delay]
                         [--availability-zone]
                         [--backup-storage-redundancy]
                         [--capacity]
                         [--compute-model {Provisioned, Serverless}]
                         [--elastic-pool]
                         [--encryption-protector]
                         [--encryption-protector-auto-rotation {false, true}]
                         [--family]
                         [--federated-client-id]
                         [--ha-replicas]
                         [--keys]
                         [--license-type {BasePrice, LicenseIncluded}]
                         [--min-capacity]
                         [--no-wait]
                         [--partner-database]
                         [--partner-resource-group]
                         [--preferred-enclave-type {Default, VBS}]
                         [--read-scale {Disabled, Enabled}]
                         [--secondary-type]
                         [--service-level-objective]
                         [--tags]
                         [--umi]
                         [--zone-redundant {false, true}]
examples: az sql db replica create -g mygroup -s myserver -n originalDb --partner-server newDb --service-objective S0
az sql db replica create -g mygroup -s myserver -n originalDb --partner-server newDb -f Gen4 -c 1
az sql db replica create -g mygroup -s myserver -n originalDb --partner-server newDb --backup-storage-redundancy Zone

commands.name: az sql db replica delete-link
commands.summary: Permanently stop data replication between two database replicas.

commands.name: az sql db replica list-links
commands.summary: List the replicas of a database and their replication status.
examples: az sql db replica list-links --name MyAzureSQLDatabase --resource-group MyResourceGroup --server myserver

commands.name: az sql db replica set-primary
commands.summary: Set the primary replica database by failing over from the current primary replica database.
examples: az sql db replica set-primary --allow-data-loss --name MyDatabase --resource-group MyResourceGroup --server myserver --subscription MySubscription
